3. CDK4: CDK4 is a cyclin-dependent kinase that plays a role in the cell cycle. Mutations in the CDK4 gene have been linked to the development of melanoma and other types of cancer.
4. Germline mutations: Germline mutations refer to genetic mutations that are present in the DNA of an individual's germ cells (sperm and eggs), which can be passed down from parent to offspring.
